recipes.title: Creamy Crab and Red Pepper Spread

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Tiamo Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                RESERVE 2 Tbsp. onions. Mix remaining onions with all remaining ingredients except crackers.                                                                                           REFRIGERATE 1 Hour.                                                                                           TOP with reserved onions. Serve with crackers.                                        Yield: 18 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Creamy Crab and Red Pepper Spread Provided by Philadelphia® Cream Cheese                                                                                                                                                                                                Nutritional Facts                                                                             1  serving equals 110 calories, 5 g fat (2.5 g saturated fat), 15 mg cholesterol, 280 mg sodium, 12 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 4 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Mix remaining onions with all remaining ingredients except crackers.
